info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 3:31PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL ARMSTRONG AND SOUTHERN CLARION COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM EDT... At 331 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of New Bethlehem, or 10 miles west of Punxsutawney, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... New Bethlehem, Dayton, Hawthorn, Mahoning Creek Lake, Templeton, and Distant. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
